alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 7:25PM CST until February 27 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Iroquois and Newton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near US-41 downstream to confluence with Sugar Creek at Watseka, including the Iroquois gauge. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Agricultural areas near the river begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. It is expected to remain near flood stage through Friday. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Monday afternoon.
